Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Basketball, Football, Hockey, Soccer
    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    A game consists a game name, exactly 2 teams and a score for each team. A game can change states such as current period, score, playing/gameover. After a game ends a game can have a winner otherwise a winner is undecided. A current period of size larger than the total number of periods represents that the game has ended. A game is not started until the startGame() method is called and the number of periods has been initialized to 1.
    Author:
    Wil Simpson

        Index referred to for the home team

      • AWAY_TEAM

        private static final int AWAY_TEAM
        Index referred to for the away team
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • teams

        private Team[] teams
        The two teams playing the game. The HOME_TEAM and the AWAY_TEAM refers to which index is for each.

      • scores

        private int[] scores
        The current score for the teams. The first index is the score for the home team and the second index is the score for the second team

      • period

        private Period period
        The period for the game

      • scoringMethods

        private java.util.List<ScoringMethod> scoringMethods
        All valid scoring methods for the game. Order is kept consistent.

    • Method Detail

      • getScoringMethods

        public java.util.List<ScoringMethod> getScoringMethods()
        Gets all available scoring methods for the game
        Returns:
        all available scoring methods for the game

      • addScore

        public boolean addScore​(ScoringMethod scoringMethod,
                        Team team)
        Attempts to add the score for the given team. If the given team is not in the game nothing will happen and the method will return false
        Parameters:
        scoringMethod - which scoring method was used to score points
        team - team to award the points to
        Returns:
        whether points were successfully added to the given team

      • getWinningTeam

        public Team getWinningTeam()
        Gets the current winning team for the game. If there is a tie then null will be returned.
        Returns:
        current winning team or null if there is a tie

      • addScoringMethod

        protected boolean addScoringMethod​(ScoringMethod method)
        Attempts to add the given scoring method to the array of scoring methods. Only is added if the given scoring method is not already in the list
        Parameters:
        method - scoring method to add to array
        Returns:
        whether the scoring method was successfully added

      • addScoringMethods

        protected boolean addScoringMethods​(ScoringMethod... methods)
        Attempts to add all of the given scoring methods to the array of scoring methods. The methods are only added if the current array does not contain that method.
        Parameters:
        methods - scoring methods to add
        Returns:
        whether any methods were added to the array

      • addScoringMethods

        protected boolean addScoringMethods​(java.util.List<ScoringMethod> methods)
        Attempts to add all the given scoring methods to the array of scoring methods. Methods are only added if they are not currently in the list.
        Parameters:
        methods - scoring methods to add to the array
        Returns:
        whether any methods were added to the array

      • getTeamIndex

        protected int getTeamIndex​(Team team)
        Gets the index of given team. Returns -1 if the team is not in the game
        Parameters:
        team - team to get index for
        Returns:
        index of team in team array. -1 if the team is not in the array

      • isTeamInGame

        public boolean isTeamInGame​(Team team)
        Checks if the given team is in the current game
        Parameters:
        team - team to check
        Returns:
        whether the team is in the game

      • hasGameStarted

        public boolean hasGameStarted()
        Checks whether the game has started or not. A game has started after the current period exceeds 0
        Returns:
        whether the game has started

      • startGame

        public boolean startGame()
        Starts the game by setting the current period to 1 if and only if the current period is 0 before being called. If the current period is not 0 before calling this method nothing will happen and the method will return false. If the current period is 0 before calling this method the current period will be set to 1 and the method will return true.
        Returns:
        true if the current period is set to 1

      • endCurrentPeriod

        public boolean endCurrentPeriod()
        Increments the current period to the next period if possible. If the game has not started or the game is over the current period will not change.
        Returns:
        whether the current period has changed

      • getNumberOfPeriods

        public int getNumberOfPeriods()
        Get the number of periods in the game
        Returns:
        number of periods in the game

      • getLengthOfPeriod

        public int getLengthOfPeriod()
        Get the length of each period
        Returns:
        length of each period

      • getCurrentPeriod

        public int getCurrentPeriod()
        Get the current period the game is in. The game is over when the current period is greater than the total number of periods in the game.
        Returns:
        the current period the game is in

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks whether the game is over and returns the result. The game is over when the current period greater than the number of periods.
        Returns:
        true if the game has ended

      • getTeams

        public Team[] getTeams()
        Gets the two teams playing in the game. The first index is the home team and the second team is the away team.
        Returns:
        array of two teams playing in the game

      • getScores

        public int[] getScores()
        Get an array containing the current score of the game. The first index represents the score of the home team and the second index refers to the score of the away team.
        Returns:
        scores for the two teams playing the game

      • setTeams

        public void setTeams​(Team homeTeam,
                     Team awayTeam)
        Replaces the two current teams with the given two teams. This keeps the current scores for the teams stays the same
        Parameters:
        homeTeam - home team playing the game
        awayTeam - away team playing the game

      • periodToString

        Returns:
